TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TripleDESCng extends System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDES

Docs.summary: Provides a Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) implementation of the Triple Data Encryption Standard (3DES) algorithm.

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string keyName) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified key name, which represents an existing persisted 3DES key.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor uses a default <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyOpenOptions> value of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyOpenOptions.None> and <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngProvider.MicrosoftSoftwareKeyStorageProvider%2A> as the default key storage provider (KSP) to open the key.

Docs.exception: Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) is not supported on this system.

Docs.param: The KSP that contains the key.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified key name, which represents an existing persisted 3DES key, and the specified key storage provider (KSP).

remarks.format: ## Remarks A default <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyOpenOptions> value of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CngKeyOpenOptions.None> is used to open the key.

Docs.exception: Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) is not supported on this system.

Docs.param: The KSP that contains the key.
A bitwise combination of the enumeration values that specify options for opening the key, such as where the key is opened from (machine or user storage) and whether to suppress UI prompting.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified key name, which represents an existing persisted 3DES key, the specified key storage provider (KSP) and key open options.
Docs.exception: Cryptography Next Generation (CNG) is not supported on this system.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Security.Cryptography.ICryptoTransform CreateDecryptor ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.Cryptography.ICryptoTransform CreateDecryptor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a symmetric 3DES decryptor object with the current key and initialization vector ().

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method decrypts an encrypted message created using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng.CreateEncryptor> overload with the same signature.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Security.Cryptography.ICryptoTransform CreateDecryptor (byte[] rgbKey, byte[] rgbIV);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.Cryptography.ICryptoTransform CreateDecryptor(unsigned int8[] rgbKey, unsigned int8[] rgbIV) cil managed

Docs.param: The secret key to use for the 3DES algorithm. The key size must be 192 bits.
The initialization vector to use for the 3DES algorithm.
Docs.summary: Creates a symmetric 3DES decryptor object with the specified key and initialization vector (IV).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method decrypts an encrypted message created using the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng.CreateEncryptor%28System.Byte%5B%5D%2CSystem.Byte%5B%5D%29> overload with the same signature.
> [!NOTE] > If you've created the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng> object using an existing persisted key and you want to make use of that key when decrypting the message, you want to set the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm.IV%2A> property and then call the parameterless <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng.CreateDecryptor> overload instead; otherwise, using this method will create an ephemeral key as specified by the `rgbKey` parameter.

Docs.exception:
is not a valid size for this algorithm.
-or-
size does not match the block size for this algorithm.

is a known weak key for this algorithm and cannot be used.
-or-
is .

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Security.Cryptography.ICryptoTransform CreateEncryptor ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.Cryptography.ICryptoTransform CreateEncryptor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a symmetric 3DES encryptor object using the current key and initialization vector ().

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this method to encrypt a message and then use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng.CreateDecryptor%2A> overload with the same signature to decrypt the result of this method.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Security.Cryptography.ICryptoTransform CreateEncryptor (byte[] rgbKey, byte[] rgbIV);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.Cryptography.ICryptoTransform CreateEncryptor(unsigned int8[] rgbKey, unsigned int8[] rgbIV) cil managed

Docs.param: The secret key to use for the 3DES algorithm. The key size must be 192 bits.
The initialization vector to use for the 3DES algorithm.
Docs.summary: Creates a symmetric 3DES encryptor object with the specified key and initialization vector (IV).

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to encrypt a message and then use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng.CreateDecryptor%2A> overload with the same signature to decrypt the result of this method.
> [!NOTE] > If you've created the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng> object using an existing persisted key and you want to make use of that key when encrypting the message, you want to set the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm.IV%2A> property and then call the parameterless <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng.CreateEncryptor> overload instead; otherwise, using this method will create an ephemeral key as specified by the `rgbKey` parameter.

Docs.exception:
is not a valid size for this algorithm.
-or-
size does not match the block size for this algorithm.

is a known weak key for this algorithm and cannot be used.
-or-
is .

Docs.summary: Generates a random key to use for the 3DES algorithm.

MemberSignature.Value: public override byte[] Key { get; set; }
.property instance unsigned int8[] Key

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the key for the algorithm.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you've created the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng> object using an existing persisted key, when you read the value of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng.Key%2A> property, an attempt to export the key will be made. In this case, if the key is not exportable, a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.CryptographicException> will be thrown.
In addition to that, if you set the value of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng.Key%2A> property, the persisted key will no longer be used and a temporary key will be used instead. If you need to use the persisted key again, a new instance of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng> class needs to be created.

MemberSignature.Value: public override int KeySize { get; set; }
.property instance int32 KeySize

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the size, in bits, of the secret key used by the algorithm.
Docs.value: The size, in bits, of the secret key used by the algorithm.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you've created the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng> object using an existing persisted key and you set the value of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng.KeySize%2A> property, the persisted key will no longer be used and a temporary key will be used instead. If you need to use the persisted key again, a new instance of <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.TripleDESCng> class needs to be created.
